Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2018
Title: Used to be a good app
Review: I used to enjoy playing this app with my two toddlers at breakfast time. But something changed in the last few months and is now 90% of the game is listening to Alexa talking about what she can do. After every Single animal sound, Alexa restarts her spiel about how she can make an animal sound or play a guessing game.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
Title: Improved
Review: Great distraction for my toddler when my hands are full. They have added many sounds over the past six months and will also give suggestions for more animal sounds (including insects, sea animals and different kinds of birds) I don't like hearing the ad for the dinosaur extinction pack over and over.p

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020

Would you like to open the app animal sounds?” And then the app animal sounds opens… And there’s a whooooioole lot more to say. My two-year-old just wants to hear an elephant.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
Title: Not good
Review: Half of the time it says you answered wrong or does not understand your answer. Gets really old shouting the correct answer over and over just to be told you're wrong and then the answer is exactly what you were saying. The sounds are ok, some of them are extremely obvious while others are really abstract, but not of thia matters when it doesnt work.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020

I had to delete the app.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
Title: Exactly what we wanted
Review: we were hesitant to try this after reading other reviews..... but the other reviewers are a bit dramatic. This app did exactly what we wanted. we ask for animal noises and it plays the noise. The noise is about three to five seconds long. Perfect for my two year old’s attention span. Alexa offers the prompt in between each animal, which might be unessesary EACH time. but the app is better than nothing!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
Title: I don’t understand the bad reviews
Review: Mine works just fine and has a TON of sounds!!  My kids love it!!  Here are the sounds that I know work (& I know there are a lot more):  cow, horse, dog, cat, goat, sheep, pig, chicken, rooster, owl, frog, snake, parrot, parakeet, nightingale, butterfly, peacock, duck, geese, seagull, raccoon, seal, wolf, rhinoceros, crow, fox, camel, alligator, crocodile, zebra, dolphin, whale, lion, tiger, bear, coyote, hyena, monkey, gorilla, chimpanzee, cheetah, panther, bobcat, alpaca, penguin, cricket, elephant, leopard. There are a few that should be there but aren’t like a donkey and a hippopotamus. Anyway, the people that say there aren’t very many sounds just aren’t very creative in thinking of animals.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020
Title: hacked or broken
Review: As others have said, Alexa won't stop talking in between animal sounds and continues making sounds without your input.  It's also virtually impossible to get the skill to stop; multiple times we said "Alexa off," "Alexa stop," etc. but each time she would make a farting noise at us and go back into her loop about how she can make any animal sound.
